actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to provide that the receipts from all Federal gasoline and automotive excise taxes shall be placed in the highway trust fund to be used for road improvement purposes only, to eliminate the State matching requirements in the Federal-aid highway program, and to provide Federal assistance for State and local highway.

summary.text: National Home Rule Road Program - Provides that the receipts from all Federal gasoline and automotive excise taxes shall be placed in the Highway Trust Fund to be used for road improvement purposes only. Eliminates the State matching requirements in the Federal-aid highway program. Provides Federal assistance for State and local highway purposes by guaranteeing that each State's apportionment of funds shall not be less than $25,000,000 annually.

titles.title: A bill to provide that the receipts from all Federal gasoline and automotive excise taxes shall be placed in the highway trust fund to be used for road improvement purposes only, to eliminate the State matching requirements in the Federal-aid highway program, and to provide Federal assistance for State and local highway.
